title: Meeting Rooms
description:
Meeting Rooms

Given an array of meeting time intervals where intervals[i] = [starti, endi], determine if a person could attend all meetings.

Examples:

  • Input: intervals = [[0,30],[5,10],[15,20]]
    Output: false
    Explanation: The meetings [0,30] and [5,10] overlap, and [0,30] and [15,20] also overlap.
  • Input: intervals = [[7,10],[2,4]]
    Output: true
    Explanation: The meetings do not overlap.

Constraints:

  • 0 <= intervals.length <= 10^4
  • intervals[i].length == 2
  • 0 <= starti < endi <= 10^6
solution_text:
Meeting Rooms

Algorithm:

  1. Sort intervals by start time
  2. Iterate through sorted intervals
  3. Check if current meeting starts before previous meeting ends
  4. If overlap found, return false
  5. If no overlaps, return true

Time Complexity: O(n log n) due to sorting

Space Complexity: O(1) if sorting in-place, O(n) otherwise

Key Insights:

  • Sorting by start time allows linear scan for overlaps
  • Two intervals overlap if start2 < end1
  • Only need to check consecutive intervals after sorting
verify:
def verify(actual_output, expected_output):
    """Verify the meeting rooms result"""
    def bool_to_string(val):
        return 'true' if val else 'false'
    
    # Convert expected output string to boolean for comparison
    expected_bool = expected_output == 'true' if isinstance(expected_output, str) else expected_output
    
    passed = actual_output == expected_bool
    output_str = bool_to_string(actual_output)
    
    return [passed, output_str]
